reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?
reply.analysis: The privacy policy explicitly states that they process personal data, which indicates that data collection is declared.
reply.reference: In this policy, “we”, “us” and “our” refer to WellbeingX Limited, the legal name of BetterSpace. For more information about us, see below. The personal data that we collect.

Introduction
Trust, transparency and data privacy are core values at BetterSpace. We are committed to safeguarding the privacy of all the individuals we deal with, including:
- visitors to the BetterSpace website;
- users of the BetterSpace mobile and web application;
- the personnel of our customers and prospective customers; and
- the personnel of our marketplace suppliers, general suppliers and other business partners.
This policy applies where we are acting as a data controller with respect ...

BetterSpace application user and you order goods, services and/or digital products from a BetterSpace marketplace supplier, then we will provide information relating to that order, including relevant transaction data and account data (excluding health data and ethnicity data), to the relevant marketplace supplier. Each marketplace supplier acts as an independent controller with respect to such personal data and, accordingly, the supplier’s use of your personal data will be subject to the supplie...

policy, we have set out the purposes for which we may process personal data and the legal bases of the processing.
Operations – We may process your personal data for the purposes of operating our website and the BetterSpace application, transacting with our customers, enabling our marketplace suppliers to supply their goods, services and digital products, generating invoices, bills and other payment-related documentation, and credit control. The legal basis for this processing is our legitimate ...

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects usage data such as IP address, geographical location, browser type, operating system, referral source, length of visit, page views, website navigation paths, information about service exercise, social connections, and goals, health data related to impairments, health conditions, and learning difficulties affecting life, and ethnicity data.

content: information about service exercise, social connections, and goals
health data related to impairments, health conditions, and learning difficulties affecting life

reply.analysis: The answer is derived from the section of the privacy policy that outlines the different types of data collected by the app, including usage data, health data, and ethnicity data.
reply.reference: The app collects usage data such as IP address, geographical location, browser type, operating system, referral source, length of visit, page views, website navigation paths, information about service exercise, social connections, and goals, health data related to impairments, health conditions, and learning difficulties affecting life, and ethnicity data. URL: https://www.betterspace.uk/privacy-policy/

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the purpose of data collection and use in the privacy policy document.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy document explicitly outlines the purposes of processing personal data, such as operations, publications, relationships, communications, research, analysis, record-keeping, security, insurance, risk management, personalization, and direct marketing.
reply.reference: In this section of the policy, we have set out the purposes for which we may process personal data and the legal bases of the processing. URL: https://www.betterspace.uk/privacy-policy/

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection or delete data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy mentions the user's rights, including the right to erasure, which allows the user to request the deletion of their personal data. Additionally, the user can withdraw consent if the legal basis for processing is consent.
reply.reference: the right to erasure – you can ask us to erase your personal data; ...; the right to withdraw consent – to the extent that the legal basis of our processing of your personal data is consent, you can withdraw that consent. URL: https://www.betterspace.uk/privacy-policy/

responsible for keeping the password you use for accessing our website confidential and we will not ask you for your password (except when you log in to our website).
Your rights
In this section of the policy, we have listed the rights that you have under data protection law.
Your principal rights under data protection law are:
- the right to access – you can ask for copies of your personal data;
- the right to rectification – you can ask us to rectify inaccurate personal data and to complete in...

about our processing of your personal data; and
- the right to withdraw consent – to the extent that the legal basis of our processing of your personal data is consent, you can withdraw that consent.
These rights are subject to certain limitations and exceptions. You can learn more about the rights of data subjects by visiting: https://edpb.europa.eu/our-work-tools/general-guidance/gdpr-guidelines-recommendations-best-practices_en
You may exercise any of your rights in relation to your personal ...

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app shares data with third parties.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the app may disclose personal data to various entities, including marketplace suppliers, insurers, professional advisers, suppliers, subcontractors, and other third parties. This sharing of data with third parties is for specific purposes listed in the privacy policy.
reply.reference: The app may disclose personal data to marketplace suppliers, insurers, professional advisers, suppliers, subcontractors, and for compliance with legal obligations. URL: https://www.betterspace.uk/privacy-policy/
